Metis

Boston class of 2014!

  • Adam Patterson
  • Alex Fox
  • David Gilligan
  • Derek Kaknes
  • Dorothy Thurston
  • Jatin Baharandi
  • Jeremy Salig

Adam Patterson

Twitter LinkedIn Other

curious, introverted, personable

What's your favourite movie?

Shaun of the Dead

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

Joseph Campbell. As someone embarking on a journey that will ideally alter my path for the better, I would love to learn and receive guidance from a man that examined who we are at our core and why we seek what we seek. I believe that many (if not all) of us in this program are here because it is the next step in discovering our own path, and I am certainly no different.

What's one skill that you could teach everyone else in class?

How to slap and pop on a bass guitar.

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

I am unable to ride a bicycle.

Alex Fox

Twitter LinkedIn Other

night owl, savvy, morbid

What's your favourite movie?

The Departed / The Big Lebowski

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

I'd like to have dinner with Winston Churchill. He was an incredibly smart man and a great leader, and I've read that he was quite the jokester as well. We'd have a good dinner, probably some delicious steaks, medium rare, and we'd dine at Buckingham Palace. Afterwards, we'd smoke a cigar and drink whiskey, while discussing the politics of Nazi Germany and WW2 wartime strategies.

What's one skill that you could teach everyone else in class?

Draw cubes...make egg drop ramen...start a fire with some logs, lighter fluid, and a match...yeah, I'm pretty skilled.

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

I'm terrible at math. Writing is my forte, I have a degree in History. People are surprised to hear this when I say I want to go into the computer programming field.

David Gilligan

Twitter LinkedIn Other

queer, quirky, quick-witted

What's your favourite movie?

Requiem for a Dream / Fight Club / V for Vendetta

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

Tesla

What's one skill that you could teach everyone else in class?

How to take over the world. Board games (all of them). Detecting logical fallacies. How to be a cat. How to avoid stupid political conversations. How to be awesome. Warhammer. Magic. How to be a (censored) sorcerer. How to drop mad rhymes (but for real). What irony actually means. The art of word play. The dangers of poor grammar. How to light fireworks with cigars. Flaming tennis. (censored)

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

I got a different friend to fill out each of the previous questions (Some of them were edited for content or clarity, and it seems my friend who answered the 'skills' question enjoys breaking the rules...) I think I learned a little about myself in the process, and hopefully you've learned a little about me too!

Derek Kaknes

Twitter LinkedIn Other

Mathematical, Inquisitive, Quiet

What's your favourite movie?

Monty Python and the Holy Grail

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

I would have to choose Hernan Cortes. I read a biography of Cortes and was blown away by his story - he led a small group of Spaniards deep into Mexico to topple the Aztec empire and capture their capital city, which was the largest city in the world at the time. The man was certainly flawed and committed some terrible atrocities, but his sheer audacity, determination and fanatical religious devotion were astounding. It's hard to admire a man like that, but I can't think of a person who would provide more interesting dinner conversation than Cortes.

What's one skill that you could teach everyone else in class?

Investment banking! Our modern financial system is so incredibly screwed up that I think it imperative that every person with a bank account understands exactly how their deposits are being whisked across the globe by their banks.

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

I'm an identical twin. My twin brother, Nick, is a medical resident in Miami, FL.

Dorothy Thurston

Twitter LinkedIn Other

silly, easygoing, chill

What's your favourite movie?

Moulin Rouge

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

No one! Breakfast is the best meal of the day. I would, however, have breakfast with Lincoln.

What's one skill that you could teach everyone else in class?

How to roll your r's

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

I've never had a pet dog or cat.

Jatin Baharandi

Twitter LinkedIn Other

adaptable, devoted, ccandid

What's your favourite movie?

V for Vendetta

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

Sir Winston Churchill. During a turbulent period in the history of humanity, Churchill captivated the entire world as the leader of the United Kingdom. He was fearless, calculated, and a wizard with his words in the geo-political arena. Surely a person with that much clout would serve as a great dinner guest.

What's one skill that you could teach everyone else in class?

How to turn one hundred dollars into zero. How survive in the wilderness, with a fully loaded RV. How to keep it real. How to live in a city with a crack-smoking mayor (TORONTO STAND UP!).

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

I have training in classical Indian drumming and can break it down!

Jeremy Salig

Twitter LinkedIn Other

inquisitive, curious, spiritual

What's your favourite movie?

The Big Lebowski

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

Steve Jobs - not so much because he was the CEO of Apple. More because he had an insightful way of looking at the world and the roles we choose to play in it.

What's one skill that you could teach everyone else in class?

How to change/re-wire a light ballast.

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

I've driven across the country 4 times. The last time I did it completely on my own.
